message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.CV 

The paper proposes a generative method that addresses the problem of creating new items to satisfy groups of users with different preferences. This involves leveraging a deep generative model, the Variational Autoencoder (VAE), to obtain a latent space that incorporates both rating performance and item reconstruction terms. The paper also applies a greedy search algorithm to jointly obtain plausible new items and user groups that would find the items appealing. Given these aspects, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.IR (Information Retrieval), and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper involves natural language processing (NLP) and image processing, which suggest the sub-categories cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.CV (Computer Vision) as possible choices.
